title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.32 - Executive order no. 32: relating to state program for day care centers for children
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.32 - Executive order no. 32: relating to state program for day care centers for children

State Regulations
I, Nelson A. Rockefeller, Governor of the State of New

York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and the laws
of the State of New York, by Executive Order, do hereby declare that all State

Departments and agencies shall make appropriate space available in suitable
buildings under their jurisdiction for the operation of day care centers for
children of pre-school and primary school age. 1. The State Department of Social Services
shall make and maintain an inventory of spaces in public buildings which, pursuant to the rules of the State Board of Social Welfare, are suitable for
use or may be converted to use as a day care center. 2. All State Departments and agencies shall
advise the State Department of Social Services of space becoming vacant which
may be suitable for such use or of any space which may become available through
construction, reconstruction or conversion which may be suitable for such
use. 3. The State Department of

Social Services shall advise the appropriate social services district and
voluntary agencies operating in such district as to the availability of such
space and shall assist such district or agency in the establishment of day care
program in such space, in accordance with the applicable provisions of law and
the rules of the State Board of Social Welfare. 4. Such facilities shall be available to all
children of appropriate age who are residents of the community to be served, but preference shall be given to those children who are most in need of such
care, including the children of families receiving welfare
assistance. 5. The State Department
of Education, Health, Labor, Commerce, Mental Hygiene, and Agriculture and

Markets, the State Division of Housing and Community Renewal, the Office of

General Services, and the Social Development Planning Commission shall make
their personnel and services available to assist the State Department of Social

Services in the development and evaluation of a comprehensive program of day
care for children of pre-school and primary school age. Signed: Nelson A. RockefellerDated: March 28, 1969
